document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the subgenus Bessobates of the genus Netelia from Japan (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae, Tryphoninae)

subSubSection.paragraph: ♀♂. Head ( Figs 8, 9 ) 1.7–1.8 times as wide as long; vertex in dorsal view evenly rounded; occiput impunctate and polished; vertex and gena evenly and weakly punctate; interocellar area polished, finely and rather more sparsely punctate than vertex; geno-orbital index 2.2–3.1 ; frons impunctate and finely coriaceous, with a weak median longitudinal groove; inner margins of eyes weakly convergent ventrally; face 1.3–1.5 times as wide as long, rather more strongly punctate than vertex; supraclypeal suture distinct; clypeus 2.1–2.5 times as wide as long, rather more sparsely punctate than face, with apical margin truncate and medially emarginate; antenna with 45–52 flagellomeres, 1 st flagellomere 1.3–1.5 times as long as 2 nd, 2 nd 2.4–2.6 times as long as wide.
Fore tibial spur 0.4–0.5 times as long as 1 st tarsomere, which is 9.1 –11.0 times as long as wide; fore tarsal claw with 13–15 (♀) and 19–25 (♂) pectines; hind tarsal claw with 12–15 pectines.

Fore wing (
Fig. 11
) 2.9–3.2 times as long as wide; areolet pointed or petiolate above; cu-a opposite or distad Rs&M by
1 / 11 – 1 / 10
of cu-a length, slightly curved or almost straight, vertical, slightly reclivous or slightly inclivous; hind wing (
Fig. 12
) with 6–9 distal hamuli; nervellar index 0.4–0.5 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 6–10.
Netelia ( Bessobates ) cristata
. 6, 7, Female; 8–10, male; 6, habitus in lateral view; 7, fore tarsus; 8, head in dorsal view; 9, head in frontal view; 10, mesosoma in dorsal view.

FIGURES 11–12. Wings of male of
Netelia ( Bessobates ) cristata
. 11, Fore wing; 12, hind wing.

subSubSection.paragraph: Head yellow; occiput and antenna reddish-yellow. Mesosoma brownish-yellow to reddish-brown; mesoscutum with reddish-brown to brown stripes on each of median and lateral lobes; anterior and posterior margins of mesopleuron yellowish. Legs reddish-yellow. Wings hyaline; vein C and pterostigma of fore wing slightly brownish-yellow, other veins brown. Metasoma reddish yellow to reddish-brown.
Ovarian egg 0.8 mm long and 0.3–0.4 mm high, with a stalk on caudal end.

Distribution. Japan (Honshu, Kyushu), widespread across the Palearctic region.

Remarks. This species is the only member of the
cristata
group in Japan and can be distinguished from other Japanese species of Bessobates by the reddish body color, besides the characters of the species group.
